snippet: Afghan investigators said quickly shifting cargo of heavy military vehicles contributed to the crash of a civilian cargo plane on April 29 in which all seven people aboard were killed.
abstract: Crash investigators in Afghanistan say that quickly shifting cargo of heavy military vehicles contributed to crash of civilian cargo plane operated by National Air Cargo in April 2013 in which all seven people aboard were killed; accident may cast new attention on quality of Defense Department oversight of its contractors.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Matthew L. Wald from Washington. Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Afghan investigators said quickly shifting cargo of heavy military vehicles contributed to the crash of a civilian cargo plane on April 29 in which all seven people aboard were killed.

headline.seo: Shifting Cargo May Have Doomed Plane That Crashed Near Kabul
headline.main: Shifting Cargo May Have Doomed Plane That Crashed Near Kabul
headline.print_headline: Shifting Cargo May Have Doomed Plane That Crashed Near Kabul
